description.value:
This PlanDefinition profile defines the logic and rules around determining: whether or not a condition is reportable to public health, which jurisdiction(s) is/are responsible, which jurisdiction(s) need to be notified, and if the condition is reportable, gives timing information, next steps and condition information to the clinician.
The profile defines three timing-related parameters for initiating case reports from Electronic Health Records (the standard does not specify the hour value for the delay of the send - public health can determine the specific value appropriate for implementation and may adjust based on review of the data available at different times) the standard conveys the parameters to clinical care but it does not require their implementation. Any requirement for timing in implementation would require regulation. TODO:
* Delay eICR construction (for example 3 hours) - the time after the start of the encounter before a triggered eICR should be composed and sent. (This delay is intended to allow adequate data to be recorded in the EHR, but is not so long as to delay reporting in critical circumstances.) If there is a trigger and the encounter is closed before the specified delay value (for example the encounter is closed in 2 hours when the specified delay value is 3 hours) the eICR should be created and sent. * eICR periodic update (for example 24 hours) - the time after an initial eICR transmission to send new eICRs as updates during long encounters. (These updates should only be applied until the end of the encounter). * eICR encounter close-out (for example 24 hours or 0 hours for no delay) - the time after the end of an encounter for a final eICR to be sent when there has been one or more trigger events. (The close-out eICR is intended to provide the full data available at the end of an encounter.)

short.value: eRSD - electronic Reporting and Surveillance Distribution

definition.value: Defines the logic and rules around determining: whether or not a condition is reportable to public health, which jurisdiction(s) is/are responsible, which jurisdiction(s) need to be notified, and if the condition is reportable, gives timing information, next steps and condition information to the clinician.

short.value: Business version of the eRSD
Name for this eRSD (computer friendly)
Date the eRSD was published
Name of the agency that published this eRSD
When the eRSD is expected to be used
The start of the time period when this eRSD goes in effect
The RCTC Value Set Library

definition.value: Reference to the RCTC Value Set library of trigger codes that this eRSD depends on
The relationship to the RCTC ValueSet Library. Fixed to 'depends-on'.

short.value: Brief description of the RCTC Valueset Library

definition.value: Name from the Reportable Condition Trigger Code (RCTC) file.

short.value: The RCTC ValueSet Library being referenced
A reference to the RCTC ValueSet Library location

definition.value: A reference to a location at which the RCTC ValueSet Library is found. The reference may be a relative reference, in which case it is relative to the service base URL, or an absolute URL that resolves to the location where the resource is found. The reference may be version specific or not. If the reference is not to a FHIR RESTful server, then it should be assumed to be version specific. Internal fragment references (start with '#') refer to contained resources.

short.value: The rules processing orchestration actions to be taken as part of the eRSD PlanDefinition.
Description of the eICR rules processing orchestration

definition.value: Description of the action containing eICR rules processing orchestration.

patternString.value: This action contains rules processing orchestration actions and information.

short.value: Text equivalent of the orchestration action.

definition.value: Text equivalent of the orchestration action. The orchestration action helps pick between alternative paths of Rules Processing which are mutually exclusive.

patternString.value: Pick between the two sequence options based on rules processing: Healthcare-based processing, or RCKMS Rules Processing on AIMS Platform.

short.value: Diagnosis_Problem Trigger Definition

definition.value: This trigger is defined as a code match between a code in the RCTC Diagnosis_Problem value set and the diagnosis code (observation.value) in a US Core Condition contained in the eICR Composition.

short.value: Diagnosis_Problem Trigger data

definition.value: RCTC Diagnosis_Problem value set

short.value: Lab Obs Test Name Trigger Definition

definition.value: This trigger is defined as a code match between a code in the RCTC Lab Obs Test Name value set and the lab test name code (observation.code) in a US Core Laboratory Observation contained in the eICR Composition.

short.value: Lab Obs Test Trigger data

definition.value: RCTC Lab Obs Test Name value set

short.value: Organism Substance Trigger Definition

definition.value: This trigger is defined as a code match between a code in the RCTC Organism_Substance value set and the lab test result code (observation.value) in a US Core Observation Lab contained in the eICR Composition.

short.value: Organism_Substance Trigger data

definition.value: RCTC Organism_Substance value set

short.value: Lab Order Test Trigger Definition

definition.value: This trigger is defined as a code match between a code in the RCTC Lab Order Test Name value set and the ordered lab test name code (observation.code) in an eICR Service Request contained in the eICR Composition.

short.value: Lab Order Test Trigger Data

definition.value: RCTC Lab Order Test value set

short.value: Medications Trigger Definition

definition.value: This trigger is defined as a code match between a code in the RCTC Medications value set and either the medication code (MedicationAdministration.medication) in a MedicationAdministration contained in the eICR Composition or the medication code in a US Core Medication Request (MedicationRequest.medication).

short.value: Medications Trigger Data

definition.value: RCTC Medications value set

short.value: Immunizations Trigger Definition

definition.value: This trigger is defined as a code match between a code in the RCTC Immunizations value set and the vaccine code (Immunization.vaccineCode) in a US Core Immunization contained in the eICR Composition.

short.value: Immunizations Trigger Data

definition.value: RCTC Immunizations value set
Exactly one of the two Rules Processing pathways can be picked.

short.value: Healthcare Based Rules Processing

definition.value: This action defines the steps/actions to be taken when Rules Processing is performed by the Healthcare facility itself.

short.value: Description of healthcare-based rules processing action.

definition.value: Description of healthcare-based rules processing action/workflow.

patternString.value: Healthcare-based rules processing workflow
Rules processing, clinical feedback, eicr, route and send.

definition.value: Text equivalent of the Rules Processing action within the Healthcare-Based Rules Processing action.

patternString.value: Rules Processing is executed in Healthcare organization or business associate

short.value: RCKMS Rules Processing On AIMS Platform

eICR, send from clinical care to platform, platform rules-processing, creation of clinical feedback
